title: Quake shakes central China; at least 12 dead
author: The Associated Press
text: BEIJING — A magnitude-5.7 earthquake shook part of central China today, killing at least 12 people and injuring nearly 400, the government said. The official Xinhua News Agency said the quake happened at 8:49 a.m., with the epicenter in Ruichang, a city of 420,000 in Jiangxi province. An official reached at the State Seismological Bureau who refused to give his name said 12 people were killed. He said it was not clear how many were injured. "The earthquake this morning was quite scary," said a shopkeeper in Ruichang reached by telephone who would give only her surname, Zhou. She said a few one- and two-story buildings collapsed and many taller ones showed cracks in their facades. Many people in Ruichang were staying outside for fear of aftershocks. She said she felt a milder trembling of the earth around 1 p.m. The United States National Earthquake Information Center reported the quake was magnitude 5.5.
